com.ibm.is.cc.javastage.api

Interface ColumnMetadata

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ColumnMetadataImpl

    public interface ColumnMetadata
    Interface that describes the metadata associated to each column. The column metadata that associated with the Information Server DataStage® link can be retrieved by calling Link.getColumnMetadata(), Link.getColumn(int) and Link.getColumn(String).
    Version:
    1.0
    See Also:
    Link

    • Field Summary

      Fields

      static int SQL_TYPE_BIGINT

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String getDataElementName()
      Retrieves the name of the type of data element in this column.
      String getDerivation()
      Retrieves the expression specifying how the data of this column is aggregated.
      String getDescription()
      Retrieves the text description of this column.
      int getDisplaySize()
      Retrieves the maximum number of characters required to display this column data.
      int getIndex()
      Retrieves the position of this column in its row.
      String getName()
      Retrieves the name of this column.
      String getNativeType()
      Retrieves the native type in this column.
      int getPrecision()
      Retrieves the data precision factor.
      int getScale()
      Retrieves the data scale factor.
      int getSQLType()
      Retrieves the SQL type of data held by this column.
      String getSQLTypeName()
      Retrieves the Information Server DataStage® name of a given column SQL type.
      Class<?> getType()
      Retrieves the Java type corresponding to this column in the given row, according to its SQL type.
      boolean hasMicrosecondResolution()
      Indicates whether this column has microsecond resolusion or not.
      boolean isKey()
      Indicates whether this column is part of the primary key.
      boolean isNullable()
      Specifies whether this column can contain null values.
      boolean isSigned()
      Indicates whether this column is a signed integer or not.
      boolean isUnicode()
      Indicates whether this column is unicode or not.

    • Method Detail

      • getIndex

        int getIndex()
        Retrieves the position of this column in its row.
        Returns:
        The position of this column, in the range 0...Link.getColumnCount()-1.

      • getName

        String getName()
        Retrieves the name of this column.
        Returns:
        The name of this column.

      • getType

        Class<?> getType()
        Retrieves the Java type corresponding to this column in the given row, according to its SQL type. This table shows the mapping between SQL type and Java type.

        SQL type Java™ object
        SQL_TYPE_BIGINT java.math.BigInteger
        SQL_TYPE_BINARY byte[]
        SQL_TYPE_BIT Integer
        SQL_TYPE_CHAR String
        SQL_TYPE_DATE java.sql.Date
        SQL_TYPE_DECIMAL java.math.BigDecimal
        SQL_TYPE_DOUBLE Double
        SQL_TYPE_FLOAT Float
        SQL_TYPE_INTEGER Long
        SQL_TYPE_LONGVARBINARY byte[]
        SQL_TYPE_LONGVARCHAR String
        SQL_TYPE_NUMERIC java.math.BigDecimal
        SQL_TYPE_REAL Float
        SQL_TYPE_SMALLINT Integer
        SQL_TYPE_TIME java.sql.Time
        SQL_TYPE_TIMESTAMP java.sql.Timestamp
        SQL_TYPE_TINYINT Short
        SQL_TYPE_UNKNOWN String
        SQL_TYPE_VARBINARY byte[]
        SQL_TYPE_VARCHAR String
        SQL_TYPE_WCHAR String
        SQL_TYPE_WLONGVARCHAR String
        SQL_TYPE_WVARCHAR String

        Returns:
        Java type corresponding to this column in the given row.

      • getPrecision

        int getPrecision()
        Retrieves the data precision factor.
        Returns:
        The data precision factor. UNDEFINED if data precision factor is not defined in this column.

      • getScale

        int getScale()
        Retrieves the data scale factor.
        Returns:
        The data scale factor, or 0 if data scale factor is not defined.

      • getDataElementName

        String getDataElementName()
        Retrieves the name of the type of data element in this column.
        Returns:
        The name of the type of data element in this column.

      • getDescription

        String getDescription()
        Retrieves the text description of this column.
        Returns:
        The text description of this column.

      • getDerivation

        String getDerivation()
        Retrieves the expression specifying how the data of this column is aggregated.
        Returns:
        The expression specifying how the data of this column is aggregated.

      • isKey

        boolean isKey()
        Indicates whether this column is part of the primary key.
        Returns:
        true if this column is part of the primary key, false otherwise.

      • isNullable

        boolean isNullable()
        Specifies whether this column can contain null values.
        Returns:
        true if this column can contain null values, false otherwise.

      • isSigned

        boolean isSigned()
        Indicates whether this column is a signed integer or not. Valid only when this column is TinyInt, SmallInt, Integer, BigInt.
        Returns:
        true if this column is a signed integer, false otherwise.

      • getDisplaySize

        int getDisplaySize()
        Retrieves the maximum number of characters required to display this column data.
        Returns:
        The maximum number of characters required to display this column data. UNDEFINED if the maximum number of characters is not defined in this column.

      • getSQLType

        int getSQLType()
        Retrieves the SQL type of data held by this column. Supported types are:
        • SQL_TYPE_BIGINT
        • SQL_TYPE_BINARY
        • SQL_TYPE_BIT
        • SQL_TYPE_CHAR
        • SQL_TYPE_DATE
        • SQL_TYPE_DECIMAL
        • SQL_TYPE_DOUBLE
        • SQL_TYPE_FLOAT
        • SQL_TYPE_INTEGER
        • SQL_TYPE_LONGVARBINARY
        • SQL_TYPE_LONGVARCHAR
        • SQL_TYPE_NUMERIC
        • SQL_TYPE_REAL
        • SQL_TYPE_SMALLINT
        • SQL_TYPE_TIME
        • SQL_TYPE_TIMESTAMP
        • SQL_TYPE_TINYINT
        • SQL_TYPE_UNKNOWN
        • SQL_TYPE_VARBINARY
        • SQL_TYPE_VARCHAR
        • SQL_TYPE_BIT
        • SQL_TYPE_WCHAR
        • SQL_TYPE_WVARCHAR
        • SQL_TYPE_WLONGVARCHAR
        Returns:
        The SQL type of this column.

      • getSQLTypeName

        String getSQLTypeName()
        Retrieves the Information Server DataStage® name of a given column SQL type. This method is for tracing purpose.
        Returns:
        The name of the column SQL type.

      • hasMicrosecondResolution

        boolean hasMicrosecondResolution()
        Indicates whether this column has microsecond resolusion or not. Valid only when this column is Time or Timestamp type.
        Returns:
        true if this column has microsecond resolusion, false otherwise.

      • isUnicode

        boolean isUnicode()
        Indicates whether this column is unicode or not. Valid only when this column is Char, VarChar or LongVarChar type.
        Returns:
        true if this column is unicode, false otherwise.

      • getNativeType

        String getNativeType()
        Retrieves the native type in this column.
        Returns:
        The native type in this column.
